oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Brass military stars
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two 5-pointed brass stars belonged to Surgeon Robert Wood Mitchell, Vaughan's 13th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. Mitchell was appointed surgeon in 1861, and was paroled in Mobile in 1865. Surgeons held the rank of major which was a single star on each collar. Mitchell served at Belmont, Shiloh, Chattanooga, Atlanta and Tenn. Campaigns. In 1872, he wed Rebecca Park. During the 1878 yellow fever epidemic in Memphis, Dr. Mitchell headed the Howard Association.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
